intro: Strigosella intermedia, commonly known as the common strigosella, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in shades of white or pale green, which are borne in clusters at the base of the leaves. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered with fine hairs. Strigosella intermedia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodland floors and stream banks.
